name: Probability Density Function (PDF)
description:
Given a probability space \((\Omega, \mathbb{P})\), the PDF of a random variable \(X\) is the function \(f:\omega\rightarrow \mathbb{R}\) that describes the probability of \(X\) taking each value \(\omega\in\Omega\). Equivalently, \(f(\omega)=\mathbb{P}(X=\omega)\). The following must hold for any PDF:

$$\int_{\infty}^\infty p(x)dx = 1$$

Note that the PDF is describing how our random variable \(X\) is distributed over \(\Omega\). In other words, PDFs describe probability distributions.
